content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia

function wrap_string(txt::String; text_width::Int=10)
    result = ""
    words = eltype(txt)[]
    iterate(push!, words, strip(split(txt)))
    for w in words
        if isempty(result)
            result .= w
        elseif length(result) + length(w) + 1 > text_width
            result .= "\n$w"
        else
            result .= " $w"
        end
    end
    result
end

example = """
Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for technical computing.
With syntax that is familiar to users of other technical computing environments,
such as MATLAB, NumPy, and R, Julia is designed for speed, performance and usability in technical computing.
"""
wrap_string(example)

```
